authors: Sutherland CS; Elston DA; Lambin X

aim: To integrate dispersal and connectivity; detectability and local demography to allow explicitly for stage-specific contributions to both extinction and colonization transition probabilities through Bayesian hierarchical modeling

authors: Che-Castaldo JP; Neel MC
title: Species-level persistence probabilities for recovery and conservation status assessment
study_site: San Bernardino Mountains of southern California
aim: To demonstrate a method to evaluate management options for 3 federally listed species by applying 3 previously developed viability metrics based on spatial rather than demographic data

aim: To analyze the colonization-extinction dynamics and local population size of the Clouded Apollo butterfly under different scenarios of management

authors: Mestre F; Risk BB; Mira A; Beja P; Pita R
title: A metapopulation approach to predict species range shifts under different climate change and landscape connectivity scenarios
aim: To suggest a framework to to forcast species distribution ranges while accounting for climate and landscape effects by combining SPOM and ecological niche models
patch_definition: dense (about 100% cover) and tall (mean height around 30–40 cm) herbaceous communities dominated by grasses sedges and rushes located near small streams temporarily flooded or waterlogged soil depressions; and tall grasslands in agricultural field margins ditches and road verges

authors: Laroche F; Paltto H; Ranius T
title: Abundance-based detectability in a spatially-explicit metapopulation: a case study on a vulnerable beetle species in hollow trees
aim: To propose a framework for using abundance-based estimates of detectability in the analysis of a spatially-explicit SPOM
patch_definition: standing oaks harbouring an entrance hole with a diameter > 10 cm

authors: Southwell DM; Heard GW; McCarthy MA
title: Optimal timing of biodiversity offsetting for metapopulations
aim: To explore the optimal timing of biodiversity offsetting in the context of metapopulation restoration for the grwoling grass frog and the Southern Emu-wren
